==⚠ Switch to EXCALIDRAW VIEW in the MORE OPTIONS menu of this document. ⚠== Text Elements Embedded files 1a971e33c50132dee0dccc8bae210e23610c8aac: $$\Delta\vec{y}_1(t)$$ 1f75c17f2fb5f4757a741a44299c249aeb79912b: $$\vec{y}_1(0)$$ d86b347233d55164f73e804007fdccf57072686c: $$\vec{y}_1(t)$$ f6aa05cbd454531f7099cd9a4c1f14e40dcd83ce: $$\Delta\vec{y}_2(t)$$ 90ea936fa6f87a60eb7cc3093ff00f3fdee85cc3: $$\vec{y}_2(0)$$ d9194075842f9bfc93f40680da0cc5061f434b08: $$\vec{y}_2(t)$$ 96a86c986ced08c80f89694a6b501c2553cee7d3: $$C$$ e6b9e39c9975e52499210616dbe20c07f39c3678: $$\vec{L}_1(t)$$ 6fe29ad3e861cc011bedf9e510d79ac6cc8ef090: $$\vec{L}_2(t)$$
Balanced parentheses language Balanced parentheses language $L$: $\varepsilon \in L$. If $S \in L$, then $(S) \in L$. If $A \in L$ and $B \in L$, then $AB \in L$.
Burtsing balloons You are given n balloons, indexed from 0 to n - 1. Each balloon is painted with a number on it represented by an array nums.
Next greater permutation We are given a set $S$ with a strict ordering on its items. In programming terms, this could be a hashmap, where each item is associated with an integer.
Nth multiple of primes We are given a sorted array of prime numbers $P$, and an integer $n$. We want to find the nth largest number whose prime factors are in $P$.
Remove K digits We are given an array of digits $digits[1..n]$, and a number $k$. We must remove k digits from the array.
When $1 + 1 \neq 2$ (and the mathematics of pulleys) Let’s say we have a pulley system as shown in the image.
